issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

comments.body:
Sample *Error Message* is like:
{code}
expected:<131072> but was:<0>
{code}
and *Stacktrace*
{code}
java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<131072> but was:<0>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:555)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:542)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestRecoverStripedFile.assertFileBlocksRecovery(TestRecoverStripedFile.java:345)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestRecoverStripedFile.testRecoverThreeDataBlocks1(TestRecoverStripedFile.java:159)
{code}

There are 2 ways to make BlockGroup under-replicated: 1.shutdown DN, or 2. replica file corruption.
If replica is corruped, and is reported to NN, NN asks DN to delete the replica.
java.io.File.length() returns 0 if the file is not found.

Thanks [~liuml07] for reporting this and [~walter.k.su] to work on this. I also noted the failure while working on HDFS-9719 but then never got the chance again.

To fix it, we would need to reliably repeat the issue, but given current test approach, it may be not easy. It looks related to mis-aligned decoding input buffers given. To expose the issue, I guess we can reorganize the tests by: 1) define all sorts of file lengths to test; 2) for each kind of file length, test the current supported block corrupting cases with the randomness. The test space will be much extended and can cover much more. Sure it will mean more test time to take.

Walter, what do you think?

bq. java.io.File.length() returns 0 if the file is not found.
I thought the block file should be there, but due to some issue its length is 0. Otherwise {{MiniDFSCluster.getBlockFile}} will return null.
{{MiniDFSCluster.getBlockFile}} on _dead DN_ is called before replica corruption and deletion. It won't return null.
Note the mentioned misordering is from the existing codes, just suggest we correct it by the chance.
Thanks [~drankye]. Uploaded 02 patch to address that.

Is it my imagination or the test is missing in trunk? If you're aware of the change, [~walter.k.su], would you kindly rebase the patch? Thanks.

HDFS-9755 covers the same fix.
Closed this as 'Cannot Reproduce'. Thanks [~liuml07] for reporting the issue.
